qas.question: The United Kingdom ruled what empire?
Which empire was the largest in history, at its height?
When did 458 million people live in the British Empire?
How much of the world's population did the British Empire rule in 1922?
How many square miles did the British Empire rule in 1922?

context: The <a0_0><a1_0>British<a1_0/><a0_0/> Empire comprised the dominions, colonies, protectorates, mandates and other territories ruled or administered by the United Kingdom. It originated with the overseas possessions and trading posts established by England between the late 16th and early 18th centuries. At its height, it was the largest empire in history and, for over a century, was the foremost global power. By <a2_0>1922<a2_0/> the British Empire held sway over about 458 million people, <a3_0>one-fifth<a3_0/> of the world's population at the time, and covered more than <a4_0>13,000,000<a4_0/> sq mi (33,670,000 km2), almost a quarter of the Earth's total land area. As a result, its political, legal, linguistic and cultural legacy is widespread. At the peak of its power, the phrase "the empire on which the sun never sets" was often used to describe the British Empire, because its expanse around the globe meant that the sun was always shining on at least one of its territories.
